parameters.formTitle: ğŸ“¸ Photo Cost Estimate Pro v2

values.placeholder: Describe what's in the photo, specify dimensions, or add context...

parameters.formDescription:
Upload a construction photo for automatic cost estimation.
IMPROVED: Multi-stage AI decomposition for accurate work identification.
Prices based on DDC CWICR regional databases (9 languages).

assignments.name: chatInput
assignments.value:
=You are an expert construction surveyor. {{ $json.system_prompt_lang }}

## STAGE 1: IDENTIFY ELEMENTS FROM PHOTO

Analyze this construction photo and identify ALL visible elements.

### IDENTIFICATION RULES:
1. **Identify ROOM TYPE** first (bathroom, kitchen, bedroom, living room, hallway, exterior, facade, roof, basement, utility)
2. **List ALL visible construction elements** with their materials
3. **Estimate dimensions** using reference objects:
   - Standard door: 2.0m height, 0.9m width
   - Standard window: 1.2m Ã— 1.4m
   - Ceiling height: typically 2.5-2.7m
   - Brick: 25cm Ã— 12cm Ã— 6.5cm
   - Tile: 30cm Ã— 30cm or 60cm Ã— 60cm
   - Socket/switch: 8cm Ã— 8cm

{{ $json.user_description ? 'User note: ' + $json.user_description : '' }}

Return ONLY valid JSON (no markdown, no code blocks):
{
  "room_type": "bathroom|kitchen|bedroom|living_room|hallway|exterior|facade|roof|basement|utility|other",
  "room_description": "Brief description of what you see",
  "estimated_dimensions": {
    "floor_area_m2": 0,
    "wall_area_m2": 0,
    "ceiling_height_m": 2.5,
    "perimeter_m": 0
  },
  "elements": [
    {
      "element_type": "wall|floor|ceiling|window|door|fixture|furniture|mep",
      "element_name": "Descriptive name",
      "material": "concrete|brick|drywall|tile|wood|glass|metal|plastic",
      "surface_finish": "painted|tiled|plastered|wallpaper|raw|laminate",
      "quantity": 1,
      "unit": "mÂ²|m|pcs",
      "estimated_size": "e.g. 3.5 mÂ² or 2.1 m",
      "condition": "new|good|worn|damaged",
      "notes": "Any additional observations"
    }
  ],
  "fixtures": [
    {
      "fixture_type": "toilet|sink|bathtub|shower|faucet|radiator|socket|switch|light|vent",
      "quantity": 1,
      "notes": "Description"
    }
  ],
  "work_type_detected": "new_construction|renovation|repair",
  "confidence": "high|medium|low"
}

assignments.name: chatInput
assignments.value:
={{ $json.system_prompt_lang }}

## STAGE 4: DECOMPOSE ELEMENTS TO CONSTRUCTION WORKS

You are a construction cost estimator. Based on the photo analysis, decompose each element into specific construction work items.

### PHOTO ANALYSIS RESULTS:
- Room Type: {{ $json.room_type }}
- Description: {{ $json.room_description }}
- Work Type: {{ $json.work_type_detected }}
- Dimensions: Floor {{ $json.dimensions.floor_area_m2 || 10 }} mÂ², Walls {{ $json.dimensions.wall_area_m2 || 30 }} mÂ²

### ELEMENTS DETECTED:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.elements, null, 2) }}

### FIXTURES DETECTED:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.fixtures, null, 2) }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
## CATEGORY â†’ WORK ITEMS MAPPING (USE THIS!)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

### BATHROOM:
1. Demolition of old finishes (mÂ²) - if renovation
2. Waterproofing floor (mÂ²)
3. Waterproofing walls wet zone (mÂ²)
4. Floor screed (mÂ²)
5. Wall tiling (mÂ²)
6. Floor tiling (mÂ²)
7. Ceiling finishing (mÂ²)
8. Toilet installation (pcs)
9. Sink/washbasin installation (pcs)
10. Bathtub installation (pcs) - if present
11. Shower cabin installation (pcs) - if present
12. Faucet/mixer installation (pcs)
13. Towel rail installation (pcs)
14. Mirror installation (pcs)
15. Ventilation installation (pcs)
16. Electrical: sockets, switches, lighting (pcs)
17. Plumbing pipes (m)
18. Door installation (pcs)

### KITCHEN:
1. Demolition of old finishes (mÂ²) - if renovation
2. Wall preparation/plastering (mÂ²)
3. Wall tiling (backsplash area) (mÂ²)
4. Floor finishing (mÂ²)
5. Ceiling finishing (mÂ²)
6. Kitchen cabinets installation (m)
7. Countertop installation (m)
8. Sink installation (pcs)
9. Faucet installation (pcs)
10. Appliance connections (pcs)
11. Electrical: sockets, switches (pcs)
12. Lighting installation (pcs)
13. Ventilation hood installation (pcs)
14. Plumbing pipes (m)

### LIVING ROOM / BEDROOM:
1. Demolition of old finishes (mÂ²) - if renovation
2. Wall preparation (mÂ²)
3. Wall painting OR wallpaper (mÂ²)
4. Floor preparation/screed (mÂ²)
5. Floor covering - laminate/parquet/carpet (mÂ²)
6. Baseboard/skirting installation (m)
7. Ceiling finishing - paint/stretch/drywall (mÂ²)
8. Electrical: sockets, switches (pcs)
9. Lighting installation (pcs)
10. Window sill finishing (m)
11. Door installation (pcs)
12. Radiator installation (pcs) - if visible

### FLOOR WORKS:
1. Old floor demolition (mÂ²) - if renovation
2. Floor leveling/screed (mÂ²)
3. Insulation (mÂ²) - if ground floor
4. Underfloor heating (mÂ²) - if applicable
5. Primer/preparation (mÂ²)
6. Floor covering (mÂ²)
7. Baseboard installation (m)

### WALL WORKS:
- Drywall: Metal framing (mÂ²) â†’ Insulation (mÂ²) â†’ Boarding (mÂ²) â†’ Jointing (mÂ²) â†’ Painting (mÂ²)
- Masonry: Brickwork (mÂ²) â†’ Plastering (mÂ²) â†’ Painting (mÂ²)
- Tiling: Wall preparation (mÂ²) â†’ Tiling (mÂ²) â†’ Grouting (mÂ²)

### WINDOW WORKS:
1. Old window demolition (pcs) - if renovation
2. Window frame installation (pcs)
3. Glazing (mÂ²)
4. Internal sill (m)
5. External sill (m)
6. Sealing/foam (m)
7. Trim/architrave (m)
8. Painting/finishing (m)

### DOOR WORKS:
1. Old door demolition (pcs) - if renovation
2. Door frame installation (pcs)
3. Door leaf hanging (pcs)
4. Hardware installation (pcs)
5. Trim/architrave (m)
6. Painting/finishing (mÂ²)

### ELECTRICAL WORKS:
1. Cable routing (m)
2. Socket installation (pcs)
3. Switch installation (pcs)
4. Junction box (pcs)
5. Lighting point (pcs)
6. Panel/breaker installation (pcs)

### PLUMBING WORKS:
1. Pipe installation - supply (m)
2. Pipe installation - drain (m)
3. Valve installation (pcs)
4. Connection to fixture (pcs)
5. Pressure testing (pcs)

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
## CRITICAL RULES:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

1. **NEVER return empty work_items** - minimum 3 works per element
2. **Include PREPARATION works** - demolition, priming, leveling
3. **Include FINISHING works** - painting, sealing, cleaning
4. **Match units correctly**: areasâ†’mÂ², lengthsâ†’m, itemsâ†’pcs
5. **For RENOVATION**: always include demolition/removal works first
6. **Scale quantities** from dimensions provided
7. **search_query must be in {{ $json.search_lang }}** for vector database

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

Return ONLY valid JSON:
{
  "work_items": [
    {
      "work_sequence": 1,
      "work_category": "PREPARATION|MAIN|FINISHING|MEP",
      "work_name": "Work name in {{ $json.language }}",
      "search_query": "Search terms in {{ $json.search_lang }} for DDC CWICR database - be specific!",
      "quantity": 12.5,
      "unit": "mÂ²|m|pcs",
      "calculation_basis": "floor_area Ã— 1.0 = 12.5 mÂ²",
      "source_element": "Which element this work is for",
      "is_demolition": false
    }
  ],
  "total_works_count": 15,
  "phases": ["PREPARATION", "MAIN", "FINISHING", "MEP"]
}

parameters.content:
## âœ… STAGE 7.5: Validation

**Checks performed:**
1. Minimum 3 work items
2. Found rate % > 50%
3. Zero cost items < 30%
4. Renovation has demolition

Groups works by category:
- PREPARATION
- MAIN
- FINISHING
- MEP

## ğŸ“Š Pipeline Overview

| Stage | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| 1 | Vision analyzes photo |
| 4 | Decompose to works |
| 5 | Vector search pricing |
| 5.2 | Parse & Score results |
| 7 | Calculate costs |
| 7.5 | Validate works |
| 9 | Generate HTML report |

## Block 1: Photo Upload & Config

This block:
- Receives photo from web form
- Extracts language/region settings
- Configures Vector DB collection
- Validates photo presence

**Supported formats:** JPG, PNG, WebP

## Block 2: STAGE 1 - Vision Analysis

### ğŸ¤– AI Photo Analysis

GPT-4 Vision analyzes photo:
- Detects room type (bathroom, kitchen, etc.)
- Identifies construction elements
- Estimates dimensions from references
- Lists fixtures and materials

**Output:** Structured JSON with elements

## Block 3: STAGE 4 - Work Decomposition

### ğŸ¤– AI Decomposition

Decomposes elements into construction works:
- BATHROOM â†’ waterproofing, tiling, plumbing
- KITCHEN â†’ cabinets, countertops, backsplash
- FLOOR â†’ screed, covering, baseboard
- WALL â†’ prep, finish, paint
- MEP â†’ electrical, plumbing

**Rules:**
- Minimum 3 works per element
- Include PREP + MAIN + FINISHING
- For renovation: add demolition first

## Block 4: STAGE 5 - Pricing Loop

Processes each work item:

1. **Vector Search** - Find rates in Qdrant
2. **Parse Results** - Extract costs & resources
3. **Quality Scoring** - Rate match quality
4. **Calculate** - Qty Ã— Unit Price

**Database:** DDC CWICR
700,000+ construction rates

### ğŸ” Vector Search

Searches DDC CWICR database:
- 3072-dim embeddings
- Top 5 matches per query
- Multilingual support

### âš¡ STAGE 5.2 Parse & Score

**FIXED:** Correct document extraction

Extracts from Qdrant results:
- Total cost from content
- Rate code, name, unit
- Resources (labor/material/machine)

## Block 6: Report Generation

### ğŸ“Š STAGE 9 HTML Report
**Features:**
- Professional design
- Quality indicators (â— â—‹)
- Calculation formulas
- Clickable rate links
- Cost structure charts
- Phase timeline
- Treemap visualization
- 9 language support

**Output:** HTML + XLS files

## ğŸ§  AI Models Used

**GPT-4 Vision** â€” Photo analysis
**GPT-4** â€” Work decomposition

Can be replaced with:
- Anthropic Claude 3.5
- Google Gemini Pro
- OpenRouter models

### ğŸ“¥ Vector Database Setup

To enable search:
1. Install Qdrant (local or VPS)
2. Add Qdrant credentials
3. Upload DDC CWICR dataset
4. Select collection for your language

Collections available on [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction)

# ğŸ“¸ Photo Cost Estimate Pro v2

### Pipeline:
1. ğŸ“· GPT-4 Vision â†’ Elements
2. ğŸ”„ STAGE 4: Decompose â†’ Works  
3. ğŸ” Vector Search DDC CWICR
4. âœ… Validation Stage
5. ğŸ“Š HTML Report

### Regions (9):
